channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Study: We're losing the fight against drug-resistant infections faster we'd thought
item.description: Antimicrobial resistance is responsible for some 1.2 million deaths a year a year and contributes to millions more. Data in the new report shows that the problem is growing at an alarming rate.
item.content:encoded:
Antimicrobial resistance is responsible for some 1.2 million deaths a year a year and contributes to millions more. Data in the new report shows that the problem is growing at an alarming rate.

(Image credit: Smith Collection/Gado)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: A Supreme Court ruling on voting rights could boost Republicans' redistricting efforts
item.description: A Supreme Court case over Louisiana's congressional map could determine the future of Voting Rights Act protections against racial discrimination and allow Republicans to draw 19 more House seats.
item.content:encoded:
A Supreme Court case over Louisiana's congressional map could determine the future of Voting Rights Act protections against racial discrimination and allow Republicans to draw 19 more House seats.

(Image credit: Jemal Countess)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: Raila Odinga, Kenya's former Prime Minister, dies at 80
item.description: Raila Odinga — the towering figure of Kenyan politics who helped usher in multiparty democracy and a new constitution — has died in India at 80.
item.content:encoded:
Raila Odinga — the towering figure of Kenyan politics who helped usher in multiparty democracy and a new constitution — has died in India at 80.

(Image credit: YASUYOSHI CHIBA)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Igunza

item.title: Gaza ceasefire deal tested. And, Supreme Court hears case questioning voting rights
item.description: Israel pressures Hamas to hand over hostage bodies more quickly, testing the ceasefire deal. And, the Supreme Court takes up a major case on that could weaken the Voting Rights Act nationwide.
item.content:encoded:
Israel pressures Hamas to hand over hostage bodies more quickly, testing the ceasefire deal. And, the Supreme Court takes up a major case on that could weaken the Voting Rights Act nationwide.

(Image credit: Ahmad Gharabli)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: In rural America, scarce doctors battle misinformation as they practice medicine
item.description: Conspiracy theories about health fill a vacuum created by the lack of doctors in many rural communities. Meanwhile, doctors in these areas say patients have become increasingly distrustful and sometimes hostile.
item.content:encoded:
Conspiracy theories about health fill a vacuum created by the lack of doctors in many rural communities. Meanwhile, doctors in these areas say patients have become increasingly distrustful and sometimes hostile.

(Image credit: Charles Paajoe Tetteh for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: Israel keeps Gaza border crossing closed while reducing aid deliveries
item.description: The ceasefire on Wednesday was largely holding, although Hamas described Israeli attacks in Gaza as violations of the agreement.
item.content:encoded:
The ceasefire on Wednesday was largely holding, although Hamas described Israeli attacks in Gaza as violations of the agreement.

(Image credit: AFP)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: U.S. charges Cambodian tycoon in massive alleged cryptocurrency scam
item.description: In an indictment unsealed in federal court, U.S. prosecutors charge the founder of a Cambodian conglomerate in a massive cryptocurrency scam, bilking would-be investors out of billions of dollars.
item.content:encoded:
In an indictment unsealed in federal court, U.S. prosecutors charge the founder of a Cambodian conglomerate in a massive cryptocurrency scam, bilking would-be investors out of billions of dollars.

(Image credit: Rick Bowmer)
item.dc:creator: Michael Sullivan

item.title: Thousands of federal employees are getting laid off. Will a judge intervene?
item.description: Unions representing federal employees have asked a federal judge in San Francisco to halt the Trump administration's latest round of layoffs, which are coming amid the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded:
Unions representing federal employees have asked a federal judge in San Francisco to halt the Trump administration's latest round of layoffs, which are coming amid the government shutdown.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Scientists are modifying wildlife DNA. Should these species be released into nature?
item.description: Scientists are researching ways to genetically modify plants and animals to be more resistant to threats like climate change. The IUCN is voting on whether those species should be allowed in nature.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists are researching ways to genetically modify plants and animals to be more resistant to threats like climate change. The IUCN is voting on whether those species should be allowed in nature.

(Image credit: Greg Torda)
item.dc:creator: Nathan Rott

item.title: How much can Tesla pay Elon Musk? Delaware's Supreme Court will decide
item.description: On Wednesday, the Delaware Supreme Court will hear oral arguments in a lawsuit over Tesla's record-setting compensation package for Elon Musk.
item.content:encoded:
On Wednesday, the Delaware Supreme Court will hear oral arguments in a lawsuit over Tesla's record-setting compensation package for Elon Musk.

(Image credit: PATRICK PLEUL)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske
